intro: Capsella umensis, commonly known as the common mouse-ear. It is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, rounded seed pods. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
